ResUseR is a bridging platform(initially open to only Monash City Council residents) between the hard waste disposer and seeker. Its chief intention is the advocacy for a greener earth. This objective is achieved in two-fold:\n 1. Increasing hard waste reuse through the network of local residents before ending up in the landfill; thereby providing people with the means to contribute to the community and offering Melbournians with a means of accessing items that are still in good condition.\n 2. Promoting awareness on the importance of reusing hard waste through informatics and multilingual support.

The city of Monash is one of the most culturally rich councils in Melbourne, according to ABSâ€™ (Australian Bureau of Statistics) 2016 census. Home to almost 90,000 residents who were born overseas, this accounts for almost 49% of the population who are now calling Monash their new home.\n Immigrants from an assortment of backgrounds (12.5% from China, 5.3% from India, 3.6% from Sri Lanka and more). In 2016, Monash City council collected 5,030 tonnes of hard waste (with only a 20% diversion rate), which required $1,030,000 in expenditure for its proper management. ResUseR believes in giving a second life to household reusables at the kerbside.
You need to be within 50 meters of the item to claim it.
